snippet: A military coup disrupted a planned second round of voting in presidential elections, and the favored presidential candidate, Prime Minister Carlos Gomes Jr., is in army custody.
abstract: Guinea-Bissau military arrest Prime Min Carlos Gomes Jr before his probable victory in second round of voting in presidential election because of his alleged agreement with military forces from Angola; country is apparently the latest West African nation to succumb to a coup d'etat.

byline.contributor: Allen Yero Embalo contributed from Bissau, Guinea-Bissau.

lead_paragraph: A military coup disrupted a planned second round of voting in presidential elections, and the favored presidential candidate, Prime Minister Carlos Gomes Jr., is in army custody.

headline.main: Guinea-Bissau Premier, Election Front-Runner, Is Deposed in a Coup
headline.print_headline: Guinea-Bissau Premier, Election Front-Runner, Is Deposed in a Coup

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
